intro: Psychotria grandifolia, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Andes. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its botanical features make it a significant species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
